Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Transport, Infrastructure and Communities and the Minister of Natural Resources, pursuant to paragraph 35(1)(d) and section 120 of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001a, hereby makes the annexed Vessel Certificates Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Canada Shipping Act, 2001. (Loi)
Minister means the Minister of Transport. (ministre)
near coastal voyage, Class 1 means a voyage

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is not a sheltered waters voyage or a near coastal voyage, Class 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is between places in Canada, the United States (except Hawaii), Saint Pierre and Miquelon, the West Indies, Mexico, Central America or the northeast coast of South America; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during which the vessel engaged on the voyage is always

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: within 200 nautical miles from shore or above the continental shelf. (voyage à proximité du littoral, classe 1)

Definition.Text: near coastal voyage, Class 2 means a voyage

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is not a sheltered waters voyage; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during which the vessel engaged on the voyage is always

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: within 25 nautical miles from shore in waters contiguous to Canada, the United States (except Hawaii) or Saint Pierre and Miquelon, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: within 100 nautical miles from a place of refuge. (voyage à proximité du littoral, classe 2)

Definition.Text: sheltered waters voyage means a voyage

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is in Canada on a lake, or a river above tidal waters, where a vessel can never be further than one nautical mile from the closest shore;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is on the waters listed in column 1 of an item of Schedule 1 during the period specified in column 2 of that item; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that is made by a ferry between two or more points listed in column 1 of an item of Schedule 2 during the period specified in column 2 of that item. (voyage en eaux abritées)

Definition.Text: SOLAS means the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, 1974, and the Protocol of 1988 relating to the Convention, as amended from time to time. (SOLAS)
unlimited voyage means a voyage that is not a sheltered waters voyage, a near coastal voyage, Class 2 or a near coastal voyage, Class 1. (voyage illimité)

Subsection.Text: These Regulations apply in respect of Canadian vessels everywhere and foreign vessels in Canadian waters.
These Regulations apply in respect of vessels that are capable of engaging in the drilling for, or the production, conservation or processing of, oil or gas.

Heading.TitleText: Canadian Vessel Certificates — Regulation 12 of Chapter I of SOLAS

Subsection.Text: On application by the authorized representative of a Canadian vessel, the Minister shall issue a Passenger Ship Safety Certificate to the vessel if the applicable requirements under the Act regarding the following are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the vessel’s structure and its main and auxiliary machinery, boilers and other pressure vessels;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: watertight subdivision arrangements and details;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subdivision load lines;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: structural fire protection, fire safety systems and appliances and fire control plans;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: life-saving appliances and the equipment of the lifeboats, life rafts and rescue boats;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: line-throwing appliances and radio installations used in life-saving appliances;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: radio installations;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: shipborne navigational equipment, means of embarkation for pilots and charts and nautical publications; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: lights, shapes, means of making sound signals and distress signals.

Subsection.Text: The authorized representative of a Canadian vessel that holds a Passenger Ship Safety Certificate shall ensure that the vessel undergoes the inspections required by regulation 7(a)(iii) of Chapter I of SOLAS.

On application by the authorized representative of a Canadian vessel, the Minister shall issue a Cargo Ship Safety Equipment Certificate to the vessel if the applicable requirements under the Act regarding the following are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fire safety systems and appliances and fire control plans;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: life-saving appliances and the equipment of the lifeboats, life rafts and rescue boats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provision of line-throwing appliances and radio installations used in life-saving appliances;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shipborne navigational equipment, means of embarkation for pilots and charts and nautical publications; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: lights, shapes, means of making sound signals and distress signals.

Subsection.Text: The authorized representative of a Canadian vessel that holds a Cargo Ship Safety Equipment Certificate shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the vessel undergoes the inspections required by regulation 8(a)(iii) to (v) of Chapter I of SOLAS; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Certificate is endorsed as required by regulation 8(c) of that Chapter.

Subsection.Text: On application by the authorized representative of a Canadian vessel, the Minister shall issue a Cargo Ship Safety Construction Certificate to the vessel if the applicable requirements under the Act regarding the following are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the vessel’s structure and its main and auxiliary machinery, boilers and other pressure vessels;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: watertight subdivision arrangements and details; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: structural fire protection.

Subsection.Text: The authorized representative of a Canadian vessel that holds a Cargo Ship Safety Construction Certificate shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the vessel undergoes the inspections required by regulation 10(a)(iii) to (vi) of Chapter I of SOLAS; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Certificate is endorsed as required by regulation 10(c) of that Chapter.

Section.Text: On application by the authorized representative of a Canadian vessel, the Minister shall issue an Exemption Certificate to the vessel if an exemption has been granted in respect of requirements under the Act that are required to be met for the issuance of a certificate under any of sections 3 to 5.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall include with the certificates issued under sections 3 and 4 records of equipment in the form set out in the Appendix to SOLAS.
The master of a vessel that holds a certificate issued under section 3 or 4 shall ensure that the record of equipment included with the certificate is permanently attached to it.
The authorized representative of a foreign vessel in Canadian waters shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the documents required to be carried on board by an international convention, protocol or resolution listed in Schedule 1 to the Act are on board; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements that were to be met for the issuance of those documents are met.

Subsection.Text: The authorized representative of a foreign vessel shall ensure that the vessel is crewed in accordance with the vessel’s Safe Manning Document or an equivalent document.

The authorized representative of a foreign vessel that holds a document required by subsection (1) shall ensure that the vessel undergoes any periodic inspections required in respect of the document under an international convention, protocol or resolution that is listed in Schedule 1 to the Act and, if the convention, protocol or resolution requires that the document be endorsed following such an inspection, that the document is endorsed as required.
This section does not apply in respect of international ship security certificates or interim international ship security certificates.
Sections 10 and 11 apply in respect of the following Canadian vessels if they are not Safety Convention vessels:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: vessels of 15 gross tonnage or less that carry more than 12 passengers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: vessels of more than 15 gross tonnage;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: vessels fitted with a boiler that operates at a pressure in excess of 103 kPa; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: vessels fitted with an unfired pressure vessel.

Subsection.Text: Sections 10 and 11 do not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pleasure craft; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: inflatable vessels, other than motorized rigid-hull inflatable vessels, that carry persons on an excursion in Canadian waters for remuneration and are controlled by a guide.

Subsection.Text: No vessel shall engage on a voyage unless it holds a certificate issued under subsection (2).

On application by the authorized representative of a vessel, the Minister shall issue an inspection certificate to the vessel if the requirements under the Act that apply in respect of the vessel when engaged in its intended service are met.
The Minister may impose terms and conditions in an inspection certificate issued to a vessel that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reflect requirements under the Act that apply in respect of the vessel when engaged in its intended service, including restricting the vessel to its intended service; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: set out limits determined in accordance with subsection (2).

Subsection.Text: The certificate shall set out terms and conditions that limit the sheltered waters voyages, near coastal voyages, Class 2, near coastal voyages, Class 1 or unlimited voyages on which the vessel may engage, if the Minister determines that the limits are necessary based on the vessel’s construction, equipment and stability and design criteria taking into consideration the following criteria in the vessel’s intended area of operation:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the wave height;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the wind velocity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the current;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the visibility;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proximity to assistance, to a place of refuge or to shore;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the navigation hazards;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the communications coverage;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the average depth of the water;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the water temperature;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the air temperature; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum tide range.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which section 2 of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001, chapter 26 of the Statutes of Canada, 2001, comes into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Regulations in force July 1, 2007, see SI/2007-65.]
